creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: robin's egg blue glaze; stand has scalloped edge on bottom with perforated repeated design at base; cup has scalloped edge
medium: Qingbai ware Porcelain with pale blue glaze
text: Qingbai cup stands with pierced trefoil motifs first appeared in the eleventh century. This type of thinly potted porcelain cup and stand can be seen in Song dynasty (960-1279) paintings illustrating banquet scenes. Intended for elegant dining, these vessels should be seen in the context of other Qingbai tableware such as the bowls, ewers, and saucers shown here.
title: Wine Cup and Stand
